business.headline: Major income tax reforms in pipeline, Budget 2025 to ease filing process: SourcesThe upcoming Union Budget 2025-26 is set to simplify India's Income Tax Act, by streamlining tax filing processes, reducing compliance burdens and expanding the tax base, Finance Ministry sources told India Today TV.
Inside Swiggy's listing gains: 70 dollar millionaires, 500 crorepati employees Swiggy market listing: As many as 70 current and former employees stand to become dollar millionaires.
'Trump time' for Bitcoin: How Donald Trump is sparking a crypto surgeSeveral industry experts believe Bitcoin's growth could accelerate under a more supportive US administration.

Sensex drops 1,000 points, Nifty slips below 23,600 amid stock market turmoilStock market today: The S&P BSE Sensex ended 984.23 points lower at 77,690.95 at the closing bell, while the NSE Nifty50 fell 324.40 points to settle at 23,559.05.

Explained: Why Sensex nosedived 1,000 points todayStock market today: For now, analysts recommend cautious optimism as the Indian market grapples with global pressures and internal headwinds, while awaiting signs of stabilization in the months to come.

Suzlon shares fall over 9% today, 22% in 5 sessions. More downside ahead?Suzlon stock price: Suzlon Energy shares dropped 9.26% in Wednesday's trading session, hitting a low of Rs 53.89. The shares also dropped 22% in its previous 5 sessions.

Sensex slides 1,000 points: 4 factors behind stock market weaknessStock market today: The S&P BSE Sensex was down 969.44 points to 77,705.74 at 2:49 pm, while the NSE Nifty50 declined 319.25 points to trade at 23,564.20.

Swiggy CEO makes rare appearance at IPO listing, shares origin storySwiggy IPO Listing: Swiggy shares listed at a premium of 8% over issue price, beating GMP estimates on the National Stock Exchange (NSE).

Swiggy or Zomato: Which stock will deliver better returns to investors?Although Swiggy is trailing Zomato in profitability and scale, analysts believe its market position and diverse revenue streams offer potential for long-term growth.

Zinka Logistics Solution IPO opens for bidding: Should you subscribe? Zinka Logistics Solution Limited IPO comprises a fresh issue of 2.01 crore shares, raising Rs 550 crore, along with an offer for sale of 2.07 crore shares, amounting to Rs 564.72 crore.

Swiggy IPO listing delivers pleasant surprise to investors. Sell now or hold?Swiggy IPO Listing: With the company's shares opening at Rs 420 on the National Stock Exchange (NSE), marking a solid 7.6% premium over its issue price of Rs 390, the performance has exceeded initial expectations

'You and I…': Zomato welcomes Swiggy on Dalal Street post stock market listingSwiggy market listing: Zomato's social media post, featuring a banner announcing Swiggy's listing, showcased a friendly nod between the two food tech giants.

Dalal Street debut goes dim for Acme Solar, lists at 13% discountAcme Solar shares listing: The stock debuted on the BSE Sensex at Rs 259 per share, marking a 10.3% drop from its issue price of Rs 289 per share.
Swiggy shares list at 8% premium over issue price, beating GMP estimates Swiggy IPO share price listing: Share list at 8% premium over issue price, beating GMP estimates

NTPC Green Energy IPO: Check price band, issue size, GMP NTPC Green Energy IPO aims to raise Rs 10,000 crore, making it the third-largest IPO of the year, following Hyundai Motors India's Rs 28,756 crore IPO and Swiggy's Rs 11,327 crore public listing.
Sensex, Nifty open flat as cautious sentiment prevails in marketsThe S&P BSE Sensex was down 76.81 points to 78,598.37, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 75 points to 23,808.45.

GIFT Nifty slips 45 points: What to expect in today's market sessionExperts mentioned that fears around Trump's potential tariff policies, especially targeting China, are weighing on emerging markets like India.

Stocks to watch: Vodafone Idea, Eicher Motors, GRSE, Swiggy, NykaaStocks to watch: Shares of Vodafone Idea, Eicher Motors, GRSE are in the spotlight as these companies will announce their Q2 FY25 results today, making them potential movers in the day's trading.

Swiggy IPO listing: Latest GMP signals weak market debut Swiggy share price, IPO listing: Swiggy shares will make their market debut on the stock exchanges after having seen an overall subscription of 3.59 times.
Jyotiraditya Scindia on Musk's Starlink licence: Approval after security complianceTesla CEO Elon Musk, the world's richest man, has been eyeing entry to the Indian telecom sector with Starlink.

entertainment.headline: House of cards actor Kevin Spacey given bail, what happens to #metoo now?From American Beauty to House of Cards, one of the most lauded actors of his generation, Kevin Spacey has a tainted reputation. In a new turn, the Oscar-winning actor "strenuously" denied allegations of sexual assault against him and got bail. Watch to know more

Images of Nayantara wearing sandals inside Tirupati temple sparks outrage against newlywed coupleAfter the grand wedding between Nayantara and Vignesh, the couple went to the Tirupati temple to offer prayers.

However, images of Nayantara wearing footwear inside the temple area has sparked outrage among the devotees against the couple.

While Vignesh was spotted walking barefoot, Nayantara was seen wearing sandals, which caused a massive uproar amongst devotees in the area.

Temple authorities issued a clarification saying it was permitted for devotees to wear footwear in that area.

Cannes Film Festival 2022: Deepika, Aishwarya walk the red carpet; Indian pavilion inauguratedThe 75th annual Cannes Film Festival began on May 17. Aishwarya Rai Bachchan and Deepika Padukone walked the red carpet on Day 3 of the 10-day film festival. 

On the second day, May 18, Union Minister for I&B, Youth Affairs & Sports, Anurag Thakur, inaugurated the India Pavilion at the Cannes Film Festival. The special event was also attended by several Indian celebrities, including Deepika Padukone, R. Madhavan, Nawazuddin Siddiqui, Tamannaah Bhatia and others.

Deepika Padukone, who is part of the Cannes 2022 jury, talked about Indian films at the event and said that she believes there will be a day when Cannes will be in India.
Disco king Bappi Lahiri passes away at 69 Singer-composer Bappi Lahiri passed away on Wednesday, February 16, at a Mumbai hospital. He was 69.

Andheri court summons Shilpa Shetty, Shamita, their mother Sunanda The Andheri court has issued summons to Bollywood actress Shilpa Shetty, her sister Shamita and their mother Sunanda over non-repayment of loan.

general news.headline: Biden meets Trump, says looking forward to peaceful transition of powerThis was Donald Trump's first visit to the White House following his 2020 election loss to Joe Biden and his refusal to accept his defeat while claiming fraud.

Pollution certificate fraud plagues Delhi's anti-pollution effortsThe Delhi government's efforts to control pollution face significant challenges due to widespread fraud at PUC centres. An India Today investigation revealed how fraudulent pollution certificates are issued, for a price.

Video: Chennai man calmly walks away after stabbing doctor, wipes knifeThe attacker, who stabbed a Chennai doctor multiple times, wiped the knife, threw it away and calmly walked to the exit of a state-run hospital, as per a video that surfaced after the incident.

Tilak Varma, Arshdeep Singh help India end Centurion trend, seal series lead South Africa (SA) vs IND (IND), 3rd T20I: India survived a scare from big-hitting Marco Jansen to become the first team in five years to defend a total at the SuperSport Park in Centurion successfully. Tilak Varma's maiden T20I hundred gave India a record total of 219 on Wednesday, November 13.

A 200-year-old British media giant stops posting on X. Here's whyBritish daily The Guardian, which was planning to exit from the social media platform X, has finally done so. The 200-year-old media giant has blamed the toxicity spread by X boss Elon Musk while supporting Donald Trump for its decision to stop posting on the platform.

Trump names former Democrat Tulsi Gabbard as Director of National IntelligenceUS President-elect Donald Trump on Wednesday chose Tulsi Gabbard, former Democratic representative, as that Director of National Intelligence (DNI).

Vendors at Delhi vegetable market asked to display names, numbers on cartsThe decision to implement this plan was made in a meeting of the market association with the local councillor earlier this month following complaints of unidentified sellers, suspected to be illegal migrants from Bangladesh and Myanmar, selling produce.
Isn't it nice to win? Trump teases a third term in meet with House RepublicansDonald Trump, who recently secured a second term in the White House, quipped about a potential third term in office.

As Delhi turns gas chamber, what should we ban today?On November 13, a day after the Supreme Court suggested a year-round cracker ban, Delhi saw one of its worst air days. Diwali was celebrated on October 31, and any firecracker smoke should have cleared by now. So, the question is, when will we stop blaming Diwali and parali, and look for long-term solutions?
Harnessing the Power of Data: IIM Kozhikode's Professional Certificate Programme in Advanced Data Analytics for ManagersEmpowering Managers with Data-Driven Insights for Strategic Decision-Making

Voting held for 31 Assembly seats in 10 states in big INDIA vs BJP contestAssembly bypolls: The bypolls are being seen as a litmus test for the Congress and the INDIA bloc following the debacle in the recently held Haryana elections.

Article 370 won't be restored even if Indira Gandhi returns from heaven: Amit Shah Amit Shah's remarks came in response to the Congress-National Conference government's resolution calling for the restoration of Article 370. He firmly asserted that the provision would never be reinstated.

Anupamaa producer Rajan Shahi supports actor Rupali Ganguly amid family disputeAnupamaa actor Rupali Ganguly received support from producer Rajan Shahi amidst controversy involving allegations from her step-daughter, Esha Verma. Shahi praises Ganguly for her dedication and humility in a heartfelt post

Delhi pollution in 'severe' category, first this season, AQI soars to 429Air quality in New Delhi deteriorated to the 'severe' category for the first time this season, with the AQI soaring to 429 due to a sharp increase in pollution driven by vehicular emissions and stubble burning, which left the city blanketed in smog.

Your 'Rahul plane' will crash again in Maharashtra, Amit Shah jabs Sonia GandhiUnion Home Minister Amit Shah took a jab at Sonia Gandhi, saying that her 'Rahul Baba' plane has crashed 20 times before and will crash again on its 21st attempt in Maharashtra.

Mahindra XUV700 clocked record-breaking sales in October. We explain howThe XUV700 is Mahindra's most expensive SUV, sitting in the price bracket of Rs 13.99 lakh to Rs 25.14 lakh (ex-showroom).

When Vivek Ramaswamy was 18: School speech emerges as he readies for DOGE roleIn the clip shared on X, the 18-year-old Vivek Ramaswamy, with confidence on his sleeve, could be heard urging his classmates to reflect on the journey ahead.

What is Fadnavis's Dhule example that has Hindutva forces worriedMaharashtra Assembly Election: BJP leader Devendra Fadnavis is citing the example of the Dhule Lok Sabha seat to warn voters. The RSS is trying to consolidate Hindu votes even as PM Modi gave the 'Ek hai to safe hai' call. What was the outcome in Dhule and is the BJP wary?

Other bizarre stoppages in cricketSouth Africa vs India: Thousands of flying ants led to the stoppage of play during the 3rd T20I at the SuperSport Park in Centurion on Wednesday, November 13. Here are some other bizarre reasons for delays in play in cricket games.

A toxic boss has a long-term impact on your mental health, but there's a way outExperts suggest that if you have spent way too much time in a toxic work environment, chances are the effects can last longer than you think. But the good news is that you can recover from it.

Nitish Kumar tries to touch PM's feet at Bihar event. Modi does this nextIn a video that has gone viral on social media, Nitish Kumar, 73, is seen walking towards PM Modi, 74, with folded hands and bowing to touch his feet. The incident happened

Actor Ridhi Dogra doesn't get affected by online trolls: Take them head-onRidhi Dogra opened up about her approach to dealing with online trolls, emphasising her resilience and refusal to be silenced by negativity. Her upcoming film, The Sabarmati Report, is set to be released on November 15.

KJo asks Maheep Kapoor: Is Shalini Passi's growing popularity a threatThe latest season of Netflix's Fabulous Lives of Bollywood Wives is creating buzz, majorly due to Shalini Passi's rising popularity. Karan Johar, in a banter, asked Maheep Kapoor if she feels threatened by Passi's popularity.

Mirror mirror on the wall, how does Kareena manage to be the hottest of allKareena Kapoor Khan attended the flagship store launch of a brand she is the ambassador of. For the occasion, she dressed in a vintage Yves Saint Laurent 2002, by Tom Ford and looked absolutely stunning.

Watch: Kareena Kapoor, Kiara Advani and Suhana Khan share frame at a store launchKareena Kapoor, Kiara Advani and Suhana Khan, who are brand ambassadors of a beauty brand, attended the flagship store launch. They posed together, looking absolutely stunning. While Kareena Kapoor chose a black Yves Saint Laurent 2002 by Tom Ford, Kiara chose red and Suhana exuded boss lady vibes in a blue pantsuit.

sports.headline: Suryakumar confirms sacrificing No. 3 spot for Tilak Varma: 'He has earned it'India T20I skipper Suryakumar Yadav confirmed Tilak Varma's place at number 3 after his match-winning century against South Africa, giving India a 2-1 series lead. Tilak's composed knock steadied the team, ensuring an 11-run victory.

Dependable Arshdeep Singh becomes India's most successful T20I fast bowlerSouth Africa vs India, 3rd T20I: Arshdeep Singh broke Bhuvneshwar Kumar's record to become the Indian pacer with the most wickets in T20 internationals. Arshdeep delivered with the new ball and at the death for India on Wednesday in Centurion.

Kusal Mendis, Avishka Fernando fire Sri Lanka to thumping win SL vs NZ: Kusal Mendis and Avishka Fernando scored twin hundreds, after which Dilshan Madushanka took three wickets as Sri Lanka beat New Zealand by 45 runs (DLS) in the first ODI on Wednesday.

Tilak Varma, Arshdeep Singh help India end Centurion trend, seal series lead South Africa (SA) vs IND (IND), 3rd T20I: India survived a scare from big-hitting Marco Jansen to become the first team in five years to defend a total at the SuperSport Park in Centurion successfully. Tilak Varma's maiden T20I hundred gave India a record total of 219 on Wednesday, November 13.

Varun Chakravarthy breaks Ashwin's record to make T20I history for IndiaSA vs IND: Varun Chakravarthy made history after breaking R Ashwin's record to become the Indian bowler with most wickets in a bilateral T20I series. He picked up the wickets of Aiden Markram and Reeza Hendricks.

Secret training in Perth? BCCI denies asking for closed-door practiceContrary to a media report in Australia, fans and media were allowed to watch India's training session at the iconic WACA in Perth on Wednesday, November 13. India will train at the WACA this week and at the Optus Stadium next week before the start of the Border-Gavaskar Trophy.

Mumbai Indians star Tilak Varma becomes 2nd youngest Indian to hit T20I hundred South Africa vs India, 3rd T20I: Tilak Varma got to his maiden hundred in the shortest format in 51 balls on November 13. He became the second-youngest Indian to hit a century in T20Is.

Carlos Alcaraz overcomes illness to beat Rublev in ATP Finals 2024ATP Finals 2024: Carlos Alcaraz beat Andrey Rublev in straight sets in the group stage match on Wednesday. The Spaniard recovered after losing to Casper Ruud in the first match of the group stage.

U19 Asia Cup: 13-year-old Vaibhav Sooryavanshi picked as BCCI announces India squadU19 Asia Cup 2024: India included 13-year-old Vaibhav Sooryavanshi of Bihar in a strong 15-man squad. The 50-over tournament will be held in the UAE from November 30 to December 8.

Rahane lauded the BCCI for pushing players to play domestic cricket more consistently.

Rahane lauded the BCCI for pushing players to play domestic cricket more consistently.

After 360 days, Shami makes quiet start on return in Ranji TrophyRanji Trophy: Mohammed Shami had figures of 10-1-34-0 at Stumps on Day 1 of Bengal's match against Madhya Pradesh in the clash at the Holkar Cricket Stadium. Shami returned after last playing in the ODI World Cup final against Australia.

Twin ducks in a series: Sanju Samson emulates Rohit Sharma in unwanted T20I listSouth Africa vs India, 3rd T20I: Sanju Samson began the T20I series in the Rainbow Nation with a hundred. In the next two innings, the wicketkeeper-batter failed to trouble the scorers.

Rohan Bopanna, Matthew Ebden slump to back-to-back defeats  ATP Finals 2024: Rohan Bopanna and Matthew Ebden lost in straight sets to Marcelo Arevelo and Mate Pavic. Bopanna and Ebden are languishing at the bottom of the group.

Kusal Mendis breaks Sanath Jayasuriya's record in twin delight for Sri Lanka Sri Lanka vs New Zealand, 1st ODI: Kusal Mendis broke Sanath Jaysuriya's record for the highest score by a Sri Lankan batter against New Zealand in ODIs. While he hit 143, Avishka Fernando also joined in to hit his first ODI hundred in three years.

India Women's schedule for home series vs West Indies, Ireland announcedOn Wednesday, the BCCI announced the schedule for India's home series against West Indies and Ireland. The ODI series are a part of the ICC Women's Championship.

Former South Africa star makes bold claim on off-form skipper Aiden MarkramSouth African legend Herschelle Gibbs has criticized captain Aiden Markram's ongoing batting struggles, suggesting he should be benched to focus on regaining form amid rising pressure on the Proteas skipper during the T20I series against India.

Ramandeep Singh makes T20I debut in Centurion, gets cap from Hardik PandyaYoung all-rounder Ramandeep Singh is making his T20I debut for India in the 3rd T20I against South Africa. He replaced Avesh Khan in India's playing XI as Suryakumar yadav introduced only one change in the team.

Women's U19 Asia Cup schedule announced, India vs Pakistan on December 15India and Pakistan will be up against each other on December 15 as the ACC announced the schedule for the Women's U19 Asia Cup 2024 to be held in Malaysia.

India Women's schedule for home series vs West Indies, Ireland announcedOn Wednesday, the BCCI announced the schedule for India's home series against West Indies and Ireland. The ODI series are a part of the ICC Women's Championship.

Former South Africa star makes bold claim on off-form skipper Aiden MarkramSouth African legend Herschelle Gibbs has criticized captain Aiden Markram's ongoing batting struggles, suggesting he should be benched to focus on regaining form amid rising pressure on the Proteas skipper during the T20I series against India.

Women's U19 Asia Cup schedule announced, India vs Pakistan on December 15India and Pakistan will be up against each other on December 15 as the ACC announced the schedule for the Women's U19 Asia Cup 2024 to be held in Malaysia.

Highlights and Reactions, 3rd T20: India take 2-1 series lead after 11 run win at CenturionSouth Africa (SA) vs India (IND), 3rd T20I Highlights and Updates: Some brilliant death over bowling from Arshdeep Singh helps India avoid a major scare due to the fiery batting of Marco Jansen, and take a 2-1 lead in the series with an 11 run win in the Centurion T20I. South Africa batters showcased a great show, specifically from Klaasen and Jansen, but the slow batting at the middle kept the 220-run target beyond their reach.

KL Rahul breaks silence about animated chat with LSG owner Sanjeev GoenkaIndia batter KL Rahul finally broke his silence over the animated chat with LSG owner Sanjeev Goenka after the team suffered a heavy defeat vs SRH in IPL 2024. He said that the incident affected the entire group.

Japan Masters: PV Sindhu makes winning start, Lakshya Sen exits earlyJapan Masters 2024: PV Sindhu made a winning start to her campaign, outclassing eighth seed Busanan Ongbamrungphan in straight games in the women's singles first round. However, Lakshya Sen lost in the opening round of men's singles.

Rodri on Real Madrid snubbing Ballon d'Or: Wouldn't have done the sameRodri, the newly crowned Ballon d'Or winner, responded diplomatically to Real Madrid's boycott of the ceremony in support of Vinicius Jr, asserting that while he respects their choice, he would not have taken similar actions if roles were reversed.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
Jawaharlal Nehru University: Brains trustTeaching and research go hand in hand at the institute which is proud of its activist tradition.
